Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 08:46AM sweetcorn wrote: I wanted to be as "normal" as possible, so I have worked all the way through chemo.  I have been on a regimen of Cytoxan/Abraxane, and have even gone in to work after the Abraxane only therapy.  I did take off the day of the Cytoxan/Abraxane treatments, which was only four.  But therapies and tolerance levels are different, so just do what your body tells you to do. Best of luck! Jane
Posts.Title: Poll: How many ladies worked through Chemo? Chrys23 Chrys23

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2011 11:31AM sweetcorn wrote: I have a score of 28, high intermediate.  My chemo starts on Wednesday, and no, I'm not happy about it but I would rather have it now than later when maybe it shows up somewhere else.  My regimen will be one week of Cytoxan and Abraxane and then two weeks of Abraxane.  Abraxane is supposed to have fewer side effects.  Later comes radiation and then hormone therapy.  My main concern is feeling sick and losing hair!  But I got my wig and am ready for it..... Jane

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 12:16PM sweetcorn wrote: I just mailed a package at the post office, the mail clerk complimented me on my "haircut." I just laughed and told him it wasn't exactly a haircut, but it is growing out after chemo.  He asked how I am doing, as he was treated for prostate cancer three years ago.  Then he gave me a Livestrong bracelet.  Such a nice encounter.  I am now 22 weeks PFC, and had a very slight "shape-up" a week ago, along with some hair color.  I do not regret the little trim, as it looks more like a style, and it was sticking out on the sides.  My part is now on the opposite side as that seems to be the way it wants to go.  My goal is to have the same hair style as Kris Jenner.  Longish on top but still short.  Pre-chemo, I had chin length hair, and my wig was a bit longer. Glad to see everyone doing so well! Jane
